verses.text_plain: But king Solomon loved many strange women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites;
verses.verse_html:
1But king Solomon loved many strange women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites; ▼
▼ together…: or, beside

verses.text_plain: Of the nations concerning which the Lord said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love.
verses.verse_html: 2Of the nations concerning which the Lord said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love.

tokens.text: to them, neither shall they come in

verses.text_plain: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.
verses.verse_html: 3And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.

verses.text_plain: For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the Lord his God, as was the heart of David his father.
verses.verse_html: 4For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the Lord his God, as was the heart of David his father.

tokens.text: For it came to pass, when

verses.text_plain: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
verses.verse_html:
5For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites. ▼
▼ Milcom: also called, Molech

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Milcom: also called, Molech

verses.text_plain: And Solomon did evil in the sight of the Lord, and went not fully after the Lord, as did David his father.
verses.verse_html:
6And Solomon did evil in the sight of the Lord, and went not fully after the Lord, as did David his father. ▼
▼ went…: Heb. fulfilled not after

footnotes.body_html: ▼ went…: Heb. fulfilled not after

verses.text_plain: Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, in the hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the abomination of the children of Ammon.
verses.verse_html: 7Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, in the hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the abomination of the children of Ammon.

verses.text_plain: And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.
verses.verse_html: 8And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from the Lord God of Israel, which had appeared unto him twice,
verses.verse_html: 9And the Lord was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from the Lord God of Israel, which had appeared unto him twice,

verses.text_plain: And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which the Lord commanded.
verses.verse_html: 10And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which the Lord commanded.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore the Lord said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.
verses.verse_html:
11Wherefore the Lord said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant. ▼
▼ is done…: Heb. is with thee

tokens.text: Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is done…: Heb. is with thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is done…: Heb. is with thee

verses.text_plain: Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
verses.verse_html: 12Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.

verses.text_plain: Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.
verses.verse_html: 13Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord stirred up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king’s seed in Edom.
verses.verse_html: 14And the Lord stirred up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king’s seed in Edom.

verses.text_plain: For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;
verses.verse_html: 15For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;

tokens.text: For it came to pass, when David

verses.text_plain: (For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:)
verses.verse_html: 16(For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:)

verses.text_plain: That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child.
verses.verse_html: 17That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child.

verses.text_plain: And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt; which gave him an house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.
verses.verse_html: 18And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt; which gave him an house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.

verses.text_plain: And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
verses.verse_html: 19And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.

verses.text_plain: And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.
verses.verse_html: 20And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.

verses.text_plain: And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country.
verses.verse_html:
21And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country. ▼
▼ Let…: Heb. Send me away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Let…: Heb. Send me away

verses.text_plain: Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise.
verses.verse_html:
22Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise. ▼
▼ Nothing: Heb. Not

tokens.text: unto him, But what hast thou lacked
with me, that, behold, thou seekest

verses.text_plain: And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliadah, which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah:
verses.verse_html: 23And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliadah, which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah:

verses.text_plain: And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.
verses.verse_html: 24And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.

verses.text_plain: And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, beside the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
verses.verse_html: 25And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, beside the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.

verses.text_plain: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon’s servant, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.
verses.verse_html: 26And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon’s servant, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.

verses.text_plain: And this was the cause that he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father.
verses.verse_html:
27And this was the cause that he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father. ▼
▼ repaired: Heb. closed

verses.text_plain: And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valour: and Solomon seeing the young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph.
verses.verse_html:
28And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valour: and Solomon seeing the young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph. ▼
▼ was industrious: Heb. did work
 , ▼
▼ charge: Heb. burden

footnotes.body_html: ▼ was industrious: Heb. did work

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field:
verses.verse_html: 29And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field:

tokens.text: And it came to pass at that time

verses.text_plain: And Ahijah caught the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces:
verses.verse_html: 30And Ahijah caught the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces:

verses.text_plain: And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee:
verses.verse_html: 31And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee:

verses.text_plain: (But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)
verses.verse_html: 32(But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)

verses.text_plain: Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father.
verses.verse_html: 33Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father.

verses.text_plain: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:
verses.verse_html: 34Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:

verses.text_plain: But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes.
verses.verse_html: 35But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes.

verses.text_plain: And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.
verses.verse_html:
36And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there. ▼
▼ light: Heb. lamp, or, candle

footnotes.body_html: ▼ light: Heb. lamp, or, candle

verses.text_plain: And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
verses.verse_html: 37And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.

tokens.text: according to all that thy soul

verses.text_plain: And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 38And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee.

tokens.text: And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken
that I will be with thee, and build

verses.text_plain: And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.
verses.verse_html: 39And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.

tokens.text: And I will for this afflict

verses.text_plain: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
verses.verse_html: 40Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.

verses.text_plain: And the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
verses.verse_html:
41And the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon? ▼
▼ acts: or, words, or, things

footnotes.body_html: ▼ acts: or, words, or, things

verses.text_plain: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
verses.verse_html:
42And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years. ▼
▼ time: Heb. days

verses.text_plain: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html:
43And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead. ▼
▼ Rehoboam: Gr. Roboam
